Class FileServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server
      • FileServer

  • public class FileServer
extends Server
    Handles connections to the FileClient. Creates a listener to accept incoming connections. Note however that the FileServer does not know who is connecting to it, but will assume that the client understands the protocol.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static FileList fileList
      The list of files that the FileServer has.
      static int SERVER_PORT
      The default port for FileServers to listen from.

    • Field Detail

      • SERVER_PORT

        public static final int SERVER_PORT
        The default port for FileServers to listen from. This port, should it be used, must be open in the firewall to accept external incoming connections.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fileList

        public static FileList fileList
        The list of files that the FileServer has.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileServer

        public FileServer()
        Default constructor. Uses the default port of 4321

      • FileServer

        public FileServer(int _port)
        Constructor to specify a port.
        Parameters:
        _port - An integer representing the port number to use to accept connections from.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: Server
        The method needs to be defined by any class that extends this method. This method will start the server.
